sample_minibatch(sample_experts=50, sample_ratings_per_expert=50, sample_objects_per_expert=50)¶

Get one mini-batch.

Parameters

  • sample_experts – number of experts to sample at each mini-batch for RATINGS/REGULARIZATION

  • sample_ratings_per_expert – number of ratings to sample at each mini-batch for RATINGS

  • sample_objects_per_expert – number of objects to sample at each mini-batch for REGULARIZATION

Returns

dict with tensors

save(directory)¶

class backend.ml_model.preference_aggregation_featureless.VariableIndexLayer(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.base_layer.Layer

Layer which outputs a trainable variable on a call.

__init__(shape, name='index_layer', initializer=None)¶
call(inputs, **kwargs)¶

This is where the layer’s logic lives.

Note here that call() method in tf.keras is little bit different from keras API. In keras API, you can pass support masking for layers as additional arguments. Whereas tf.keras has compute_mask() method to support masking.

Parameters

  • inputs – Input tensor, or list/tuple of input tensors.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments. Currently unused.

Returns

A tensor or list/tuple of tensors.
